entry.title: Face My Fears
entry.summary:
Author: MysticRose1992

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 70,259Chapters: 16/?Kudos: 3,320

Summary: During what Red Hood thought was just a routine check of all of the warehouses in his territory, making sure no new gang was going to start a gang war, he stumbles upon a scene that would haunt his nightmares. A Death Cult about to sacrifice a child that could be no older than 4. After dealing with the cult members, Jason finds himself the new caretaker of a 4 year old toddler that also happens to be able to turn invisible when startled. What could possibly go wrong?

entry.title: I Just Wanna Make You Feel Okay
entry.summary:
Author: Ekkolocation

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,946Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 28

Summary: Bruce always has, and always will, work himself until he breaks. ¬† "Honey, did you get any sleep last night?" They've done this song and dance a million times before but Clark will never stop asking. Will never stop worrying. Bruce lets out a heavy sigh. "No." ‚ÄúDid you sleep at all while I was gone?" Bruce sucks in a deep breath before replying. Something he does when he's embarrassed or ashamed of what he's about to admit. "A bit. Kept waking up in pain. Unable to fall asleep again afterwards." OR Bruce deals with chronic pain and fatigue and Clark knows just how to take care of him.

entry.title: Colors
entry.summary:
Author: ladyshipper06

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,278Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 103

Summary: ‚ÄúWhy didn‚Äôt you tell me?‚Äù Bruce‚Äôs voice cuts him off. It‚Äôs low, rough, almost a whisper, but it carries something deeper than reproach. Clark knows it. His blue-gray eyes lock onto Clark‚Äôs, and for a moment the world seems to stop. His gaze is clear, cold, but not harsh. There‚Äôs no judgment. No anger. Just a quiet understanding. Clark looks down at the mug. He swallows and shakes his head, tormented. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt know,‚Äù he replies, his voice breaking. There‚Äôs exhaustion in his tone. What makes him tremble isn‚Äôt fear‚Äîit‚Äôs disappointment. Disappointment in himself. His expression, usually calm, looks lost, disoriented, as if every word Bruce speaks is stabbing him, even though he knows that isn‚Äôt his intent. Bruce watches him. There‚Äôs nothing in his eyes that suggests disbelief, but Clark can‚Äôt quite read him. The city‚Äôs night light spills in through the window, illuminating Bruce‚Äôs tired face, dark circles beneath his eyes. [...] What would have happened if Batman were present in the 2025 Superman movie?

entry.title: I never thought I'd live this long
entry.summary:
Author: Wings_of_icarus13

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 22,333Chapters: 5/7Kudos: 23

Summary: Two men with busy lives somehow make time for each other. One is a grumpy billionaire who kicks the shit out of people at night while dressing up as a flying rat out of a sense of masochistic justice, and the other is an alien with equally questionnable wardrobe choices trying very hard to belong. They meet. They befriend each other. Their families befriend each other. Then what? Or, I made up my own SuperBat canon timeline out of my favourite narrative choices and now you'll endure a fifteen years long slow burn.

entry.title: And you can quote me on that
entry.summary:
Author: maruja35

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,201Chapters: 11/14Kudos: 96

Summary: In a deviation from expectations, Clark and Bruce meet for the first time not as Superman and Batman, and not as reporter and billionaire business owner, but as some version of themselves somewhere in the middle of all their respective identities.Clark nods, pushes his glasses back into place, smiles. It's sweet. It's comfortable. Bruce feels a sense of peace ‚Äî there's no need to rush this. He steals one last kiss, then walks back to his car. He remembers to text Clark later, when he's back at the manor and before patrol, letting him know he made it home safe and wishing him a good night. He sees Clark again, unplanned, unexpected, Saturday night. Or After the Rift, Clark keeps moving. He's a bit lonely, a bit less trusted than he was before, a bit optimistic about a budding new friendship - relationship? He's determined not to mess things up, but he will. Things never work out just right. Meanwhile, Bruce throws caution to the wind and lets someone in for a change. He thinks it's fine, until he makes eye contact with him from across the room and feels the cool knife of betrayal slide between his ribs. It only gets more complicated from there.
